Week 33: Landing

20 Aug 2023

  • The first week back at work is fairly quiet, I even found myself on the verge of boredom at one point. Organically, this makes me feel bad, but I remind myself that weeks before and after holidays tend to have this effect on my life. I tell myself I‚Äôm just landing.
  • No one can convince me the municipality of Amsterdam isn‚Äôt using major construction projects to show tourists how crap the city can be. On Sunday, I go for a long bike ride to Amsterdamse Bos and back, and crossing the Berlagebrug I‚Äôm struck by how quiet the street is without cars racing by. I like it.
  • I finished watching The Righteous Gemstones , and I miss them already.
  • Anja‚Äôs still off for the summer, and I‚Äôm watching her slowly recover from being my personal chauffeur for two weeks
  • The Summer makes me not want to cook. It‚Äôs no help that I‚Äôm using Annelie‚Äôs apartment to work while she‚Äôs travelling, and that I use the occasion to order poke bowls for lunch. I‚Äôm surprised by the quality of Poke Perfect‚Äôs teriyaki chicken bowl, extra edamame.
  • I‚Äôm reading and enjoying Robin Meyer‚Äôs Saving Jesus From the Church , a tool to make my interest in orthopraxy more tangible.
